title: Structural Evolution of Alloyed Aluminum Nitride Heterostructures
content: Wurtzite-structured materials, which have been recognized for over a century, were previously regarded as polar materials without any indication of ferroelectric properties. However, recent developments have shown that wurtzite-type materials, particularly in the form of thin films, do indeed exhibit ferroelectricity. This quality is particularly pronounced in solid solution compositions such as AlScN [1], AlBN [2], ZnMgO [3], and GaScN [4]. These findings have created exciting opportunities for the construction of microelectronic devices that capitalize on the compatibility of wurtzite-based thin films with CMOS-production processes. The ferroelectric properties of these materials, including high spontaneous polarization, exceptional retention, and notable scalability, make them well-suited for low power consumption memory devices.
